ThingDef.label: Iron Bloom
ThingDef.description: An unrefined product of smelting iron ore in a bloomery. It's porous and is full of slag and impurities, so is quite worthless until it is forged into wrought iron by removing the other components with heat and a hammer.

ThingDef.label: Pig Iron Ingot
ThingDef.description: When iron ore is smelted in a high-temperature blast furnace, you get pig iron—a crude, useless intermediate product which is very high in carbon. It can be further refined by melting in a foundry to produce high-carbon cast iron, or decarbonized into useful wrought iron at a finery forge or puddling furnace.
